attributes.action: Change the start of Vehicle Excise Duty to the exact day that it is purchased
attributes.additional_details:
Commencement should be from the date of purchase. 

For example, if a person was to purchase their VED on 31st October 2015, expiry would be September 30th 2016. 

This is an unfair system and leads to motorists losing up to 1 months VED on their vehicle.

I would like the UK Department of Transport to change this unfair and unjust rule, to commencement when purchased.
attributes.background: The UK has had an abolition of tax discs in vehicles. Therefore, there is no reason for the date of expiry to be the end of the calendar month.
